column2: WEST VIRGINIA DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column8: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column10: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 2. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column8: the pedestrian

column2: 3. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column8: exceed the speed limit

column2: 4. The yield sign means:
column8: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column10: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 5. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column6: towards the right side of the road.
column8: straight down the middle of the road.
column10: towards the left side of the road.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column8: T-intersection ahead

column2: 7. This sign warns that:
column6: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.
column8: traffic must merge left.

column2: 8. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column8: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column10: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 9. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column6: Pass only in the right lane
column8: No left turn
column10: Cars in right lane must slow down

column2: 11. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column8: Warning signs

column2: 12. This sign means:
column4: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column8: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column10: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 13. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column8: 30 minutes.

column2: 14. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: speed up to beat the red light.
column6: stop and wait for the light to change.
column8: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column10: proceed with caution through the intersection.

column2: 15. A flashing red light:
column4: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.
column8: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 16. This signal means:
column8: Proceed

column2: 17. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column6: slow down until it passes you.
column8: increase your speed to provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle.
column10: pull over to the side of the road and stop.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column8: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column10: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.

column2: 19. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.
column6: move your eyes to the right.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 20. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column8: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
